thread.title: WATCH: Cam Newton with Oscar-worthy flop vs. Eagles
thread.title_full: WATCH: Cam Newton with Oscar-worthy flop vs. Eagles | NJ.com

author: Matt Lombardo | For NJ Advance Media
title: WATCH: Cam Newton with Oscar-worthy flop vs. Eagles
text:
Cam Newton was either lightly pushed and tried to draw a flag or struck by lightning. https://t.co/MKW7QAQVSh pic.twitter.com/bvPaiDxp4r
â€” SB Nation (@SBNation) October 26, 2015
Give Carolina Panthers quarterback Cam Newton credit for trying.
With the Panthers driving deep inside the red-zone, Newton drew the Eagles offsides and proceeded to flop to the ground and play dead before getting back up and scoring a touchdown two plays later.
Newton was clearly trying to draw a 15-yard unnecessary roughness penalty on Logan, but sabotaged his own efforts by visibly cracking up laughing while the officials discussed whether or not to throw an additional flag.
Eagles nose tackle Bennie Logan jumped offsides on the play in the video above that inspired Newton's flop that would make an NBA player proud, before the LSU product was called for encroachment on the very next play.
Following the penalties, Newton scored on a two-yard run.
The Panthers led the Eagles 14-6 at halftime with Newton completing 6-of-11 passing with two interceptions and adding three rushes for four yards and a touchdown.
